intro: Nerium jaspideum, commonly known as the golden oleander, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant has simple, opposite, and often hairy leaves that are dark green in color. It produces a milky sap that can be toxic, and its flowers are typically borne on long, slender peduncles. Nerium jaspideum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
